title: #14 ¿Estás enfadado por el club de Satanás después de la escuela de tu hijo? Culpa al juez del Tribunal Supremo de los EEUU, Clarence Thomas (eng)
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#8](c8#c-8) Ya están los jueves para denegar https://www.poderjudicial.es/cgpj/es/Poder-Judicial/Noticias-Judiciales/La-Audiencia-Nacional-deniega-la-inscripcion-a-la-denominada--Iglesia-Pastafari--en-el-registro-de-entidades-religiosas
Porque solo las cosas imaginarias que ellos quieren pueden adorarse
[#2](c2#c-2) Me lo imagino tal que asi...
https://tenor.com/es/view/farray-apm-apmtv3-ignatius-vida-moderna-gif-15730677
[#2](c2#c-2) He buscado el nombre de ese sujeto en el buscador y la cantidad de noticias es abrumadora, dame algo de contexto porfa.
[#11](c11#c-11) Es un magistrado del Supremo de EE.UU que es extremadamente conservador, particularmente resentido, y sorprendentemente corrupto.
En el caso concreto que nos ocupa, el conservador Clarence Thomas, junto con el resto de magistrados conservadores del Supremo, estableció que los clubes cristianos en los colegios no suponen una violación del principio de separación iglesia-estado, y ahora llega una consecuencia insospechada.
"juez".
Qué ganas que cambien a estos por una IA que sólo emplee en sus sentencias fundamentos jurídicos y no opiniones personales.

author: 今傳媒- 記者李祖東
title: 高雄苓洲國小通學步道換新 營造社區通行友善環境
text:
高雄苓洲國小通學步道換新 營造社區通行友善環境
今傳媒/今傳媒- 記者李祖東
7 分鐘前
【今傳媒/記者李祖東報導】為提升苓洲國小通學安全及周邊步行品質，工務局道路養護工程處已於近日完成苓洲國小中華四路及自強三路通學道整新，改善總面積約1,225平方公尺，除改換耐久優質美觀鋪面，並改善坡道、路口無障礙設計，另於中華四維轉角路口新設護欄，提供人行安心友善環境。
苓雅區苓洲國小創校已超過百年歲月，結合傳統社區文化持續發展國際教育，當地人共同回憶歷久彌新。該校周邊屬商業區，多為金融業、旅宿業等住商大樓，鄰近阮綜合醫院、苓雅市場與自強夜市、三多商圈，其通學動線所在的中華四路及自強三路，同時也是許多人通勤、就醫、逛街的行經路線。
道工處指出，為避免既有通學步道磚面老舊、樹木竄根等情形影響通行安全，道工處配合教育局及學校進行通學道優化，將步道鋪面以更為平整、耐久、美觀的混凝土換新，改善路口、坡道的無障礙設計並設置導盲磚，同時將路側改設連續植栽帶，與擴大外圍高齡老榕樹植穴，以增加喬木生長空間，減少竄根對鋪面造成破壞，達成環境共存共融的理念。此外，針對交通量大的中華四路與四維四路轉角路口增設護欄，減緩事故發生可能對行人帶來的衝擊，保障民眾行走與路口停等安全。
市府強化學童通行安全不遺餘力，苓洲國小吳校長對通學步道改善成果也表示滿意，家長對學童上下學安全亦較放心。道工處補充，校園通學道是學生上下學的重要廊道，並可銜接周邊人行道，聯結景點、市集或民生重要場域，成為社區通行與大眾運輸轉乘路網的一環，也增進低碳運輸效能，市府會持續推動人行環境改善，打造能安心暢行的優質公共空間。

author: AFP
title: South Africa crush Indian hopes with innings victory in Centurion - Breitbart
text: India’s dream of winning a Test series in South Africa for the first time was ended inside three days as they crashed to an innings and 32 runs defeat at SuperSport Park in Centurion on Thursday. With the series consisting of only two matches they can at best earn a share of the honours if they win the second Test starting in Cape Town on Wednesday. “We’ll regroup and come back,” said Indian captain Rohit Sharma after the game. “It’s important to regroup as quickly as we can, tough from a loss like these but as sportsmen you go through these times. Got to pick ourselves up.” India had no answer to South Africa’s pace attack as they crashed to 131 all out in their second innings, after conceding a 163-run first innings lead. A day which started with the match evenly poised turned into a rout for the tourists. Dean Elgar (185) and Marco Jansen (84 not out) transformed a slender 11-run lead for South Africa at the start of play into a strong position. They shared a 111-run sixth wicket partnership as South Africa took an overnight 256 for five to 408 all out despite the absent of injured captain Temba Bavuma. Virat Kohli hit an aggressive 76 for India before he was last man out but the rest of the batting collapsed against South Africa’s fast bowlers on a lively pitch. The second innings lasted just 34.1 overs. Kohli hit 12 fours and a six in an 82-ball innings. Shubman Gill made 26 but no other batsman scored more than six. “Having been sent in we got decent runs on the board,” said Sharma. “But we failed to exploit the conditions with the ball and our batting was poor in the second innings.” Kagiso Rabada set the tone for South Africa, bowling Sharma for a duck with a superb delivery which deviated off the pitch to hit the off stump. Rabada, who took five for 59 in the first innings, took two for 32 and finished the match with an outstanding diving catch at long-on to dismiss Kohli off Jansen, who took three for 36. Bavuma out Left-arm fast bowler Nandre Burger completed an impressive debut Test by taking four for 33, giving him match figures of seven for 83. Three catches went down in the slip cordon but none proved expensive. Elgar was named man of the match in his final Test on his home ground. He has announced he will retire from international cricket after the second Test. “It was pretty special for me,” he said. “It (the pitch) was pretty juicy. You’ve got to keep it nice and simple batting in Tests. Focus on the ball, play straight and play late.” It was a policy which India were unable to follow, although Sharma paid tribute to KL Rahul for his “brilliant” century in the first innings. South Africa captain Bavuma took no further part in the match after injuring his left hamstring on the first morning. Coach Shukri Conrad confirmed later that Bavuma would not play in the second Test. Former captain Elgar, who led the team on the field after Bavuma’s injury, will captain the team in Cape Town.
